alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Howell; Ozark; Texas (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 8:31AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Ozark, eastern Douglas, Howell and south central Texas Counties through 900 AM CDT... At 831 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 13 miles west of Willow Springs to near Gainesville. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... West Plains, Bull Shoals Lake, Mountain View, Willow Springs, Cabool, Gainesville, Pomona, Bakersfield, South Fork, Pontiac, Brandsville, Lanton, Brixey, Willhoit, Tecumseh, Pottersville, Caulfield, Udall, Hardenville and Zanoni. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for south central and southwestern Missouri. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for south central and southwestern Missouri.
